name: Katie Britt
bio: Katie Britt is the junior U.S. Senator from Alabama, elected in 2022. She is the first woman elected to the Senate from Alabama and the youngest Republican woman ever elected. She previously served as CEO of the Business Council of Alabama and as chief of staff to Senator Richard Shelby.
education: University of Alabama (BS in Political Science, JD in Law)
endorsements: National Right to Life, Alabama Farmers Federation, Susan B. Anthony Pro-Life America
platform: Economic growth, border security, parental rights, and opposition to federal overreach.

platformFollowThrough.Border Security: Serves on the Senate Judiciary Subcommittee on Border Security and Immigration. Advocated for increased enforcement and criticized soft-on-crime policies in Democrat-led cities.
platformFollowThrough.Economic Growth: Supports deregulation and tax relief for small businesses. Previously led the Business Council of Alabama.
platformFollowThrough.Parental Rights: Opposes federal mandates on education and supports school choice initiatives.
platformFollowThrough.Federal Overreach: Requested her Senate salary be withheld during the 2025 government shutdown to protest congressional inaction.

proposals: Increase penalties for fentanyl trafficking, expand rural broadband, and protect parental rights in education.

name: Tommy Tuberville
bio: Tommy Tuberville is the senior U.S. Senator from Alabama, elected in 2020. Before entering politics, he was a college football coach for over two decades, most notably at Auburn University. He defeated incumbent Doug Jones and has since aligned with conservative priorities in the Senate.
education: Southern Arkansas University (BS in Physical Education)
endorsements: National Rifle Association, Alabama Republican Party
platform: Election integrity, border security, military readiness, and opposition to ESG mandates.

platformFollowThrough.Election Integrity: Supported legislation to tighten voter ID laws and restrict federal oversight of state elections.
platformFollowThrough.Border Security: Advocated for increased funding for border patrol and opposed immigration reform bills.
platformFollowThrough.Military Readiness: Refused to lift a hold on military promotions in protest of Pentagon abortion travel policy, drawing bipartisan criticism.
platformFollowThrough.Opposition to ESG: Criticized environmental, social, and governance investing mandates in federal retirement plans.

proposals: Ban ESG investing in federal portfolios, restrict DEI programs in military training, and expand rural veteran services.

name: Lisa Murkowski
bio: Lisa Murkowski is the senior U.S. Senator from Alaska, serving since 2002. She is known for her centrist positions and willingness to cross party lines. Murkowski was appointed by her father, then-Governor Frank Murkowski, and has since won multiple elections, including a historic write-in campaign in 2010.
education: Georgetown University (BA in Economics), Willamette University College of Law (JD)
endorsements: League of Conservation Voters, Planned Parenthood Action Fund, Alaska Federation of Natives
platform: Bipartisanship, energy development, reproductive rights, and tribal sovereignty.

platformFollowThrough.Bipartisanship: Frequently votes across party lines and was one of the few Republicans to convict Trump in his second impeachment trial.
platformFollowThrough.Energy Development: Supports responsible oil and gas exploration in Alaska, including ANWR, while balancing environmental concerns.
platformFollowThrough.Reproductive Rights: Reintroduced bipartisan legislation to codify Roe v. Wade and protect abortion access.
platformFollowThrough.Tribal Sovereignty: Advocates for Alaska Native rights and increased federal support for tribal health and education programs.

proposals: Expand rural healthcare access, codify abortion rights, and invest in Arctic infrastructure.

name: Dan Sullivan
bio: Dan Sullivan is the junior U.S. Senator from Alaska, elected in 2014. A Marine Corps veteran and former Alaska Attorney General, Sullivan has focused on national defense, energy development, and veterans’ issues throughout his tenure.
education: Harvard University (BA), Georgetown University (MS in Foreign Service, JD)
endorsements: National Federation of Independent Business, Alaska Miners Association, Veterans of Foreign Wars PAC
platform: Energy independence, national security, economic growth, and support for veterans.

platformFollowThrough.Energy Independence: Advocated for expanded oil and gas development in Alaska, including offshore drilling and ANWR access.
platformFollowThrough.National Security: Serves on the Senate Armed Services Committee and supports increased defense spending and Arctic readiness.
platformFollowThrough.Economic Growth: Supports deregulation and tax incentives for small businesses and resource industries.
platformFollowThrough.Support for Veterans: Championed legislation to improve VA services and expand mental health support for rural veterans.

proposals: Expand Arctic infrastructure, streamline permitting for energy projects, and increase funding for military installations in Alaska.

name: Ruben Gallego
bio: Ruben Gallego is the junior U.S. Senator from Arizona, elected in 2024 after serving five terms in the U.S. House. A Marine Corps veteran and Harvard graduate, Gallego is the first Latino elected to represent Arizona in the Senate. He previously served in the Arizona House of Representatives and has focused on veterans’ issues, tribal sovereignty, and economic justice.
education: Harvard University (BA in International Relations)
endorsements: VoteVets, Latino Victory Fund, Arizona AFL-CIO
platform: Veterans’ services, tribal sovereignty, economic justice, and immigration reform.

platformFollowThrough.Veterans’ Services: Championed expanded mental health support and rural access for veterans through VA modernization bills.
platformFollowThrough.Tribal Sovereignty: Advocated for increased federal trust responsibilities and funding for Indigenous communities.
platformFollowThrough.Economic Justice: Supports raising the federal minimum wage and expanding affordable housing programs.
platformFollowThrough.Immigration Reform: Backed bipartisan efforts to protect Dreamers and streamline legal immigration pathways.

proposals: Codify protections for Dreamers, expand VA mental health services, and invest in broadband access for underserved communities.

name: Mark Kelly
bio: Mark Kelly is the junior U.S. Senator from Arizona, elected in a 2020 special election and reelected in 2022. A former NASA astronaut and U.S. Navy captain, Kelly has focused on gun safety, veterans’ issues, and water security in the Southwest. He is married to former Congresswoman Gabrielle Giffords.
education: United States Merchant Marine Academy (BS), Naval Postgraduate School (MS in Aeronautical Engineering)
endorsements: Giffords PAC, Sierra Club, End Citizens United
platform: Gun safety, veterans’ services, water conservation, and campaign finance reform.

platformFollowThrough.Gun Safety: Supports universal background checks and red flag laws; co-sponsored legislation to close loopholes in firearm purchases.
platformFollowThrough.Veterans’ Services: Advocated for expanded mental health care and housing support for veterans.
platformFollowThrough.Water Conservation: Pushed for federal investment in drought resilience and Colorado River basin sustainability.
platformFollowThrough.Campaign Finance Reform: Supports overturning Citizens United and increasing transparency in political donations.

proposals: Expand background checks, invest in water infrastructure, and strengthen VA mental health programs.

name: John Boozman
bio: John Boozman is the senior U.S. Senator from Arkansas, serving since 2011. A former optometrist and U.S. Representative, Boozman has focused on agriculture, veterans’ affairs, and rural development. He chairs the Senate Appropriations Subcommittee on Military Construction and Veterans Affairs and is known for his quiet, consensus-building style.
education: University of Arkansas, Southern College of Optometry (OD)
endorsements: Arkansas Farm Bureau, National Rifle Association, American Legion
platform: Agriculture, veterans’ services, rural infrastructure, and conservative fiscal policy.

platformFollowThrough.Agriculture: Chairs the Senate Agriculture Committee and supports farm subsidies, crop insurance, and rural development programs.
platformFollowThrough.Veterans’ Services: Sponsored legislation to modernize VA facilities and expand mental health access for veterans.
platformFollowThrough.Rural Infrastructure: Advocated for broadband expansion and water system upgrades in underserved communities.
platformFollowThrough.Conservative Fiscal Policy: Supports balanced budgets, reduced federal spending, and tax relief for small businesses.

proposals: Expand rural broadband, improve VA disability exam access, and streamline farm program enrollment.

name: Tom Cotton
bio: Tom Cotton is the junior U.S. Senator from Arkansas, elected in 2014 after serving one term in the U.S. House. A Harvard-educated Army veteran, Cotton has built a reputation as a hawkish conservative focused on national security, immigration enforcement, and judicial appointments.
education: Harvard University (BA in Government, JD)
endorsements: National Right to Life Committee, Club for Growth, Arkansas State Chamber of Commerce
platform: National security, immigration enforcement, judicial integrity, and fiscal conservatism.

platformFollowThrough.National Security: Supports increased defense spending and has sponsored legislation to counter Chinese and Iranian influence.
platformFollowThrough.Immigration Enforcement: Advocated for stricter border controls and merit-based immigration reforms.
platformFollowThrough.Judicial Integrity: Backed conservative judicial nominees and opposed court-packing proposals.
platformFollowThrough.Fiscal Conservatism: Supports balanced budgets, reduced federal spending, and tax cuts for businesses.

proposals: Ban TikTok nationwide, expand military cyber capabilities, and restrict asylum loopholes.

name: Alex Padilla
bio: Alex Padilla is the senior U.S. Senator from California, appointed in 2021 to fill Kamala Harris’s vacated seat and elected to a full term in 2022. He previously served as California’s Secretary of State and in the State Senate. Padilla is the first Latino Senator from California and has focused on immigration reform, climate resilience, and voting rights.
education: Massachusetts Institute of Technology (BS in Mechanical Engineering)
endorsements: California Labor Federation, Sierra Club, UnidosUS Action Fund
platform: Immigration reform, climate resilience, voting rights, and disaster recovery.

platformFollowThrough.Immigration Reform: Sponsored bills to protect Dreamers and streamline legal immigration pathways, including the Citizenship for Essential Workers Act.
platformFollowThrough.Climate Resilience: Introduced legislation to accelerate fusion energy development and expand wildfire mitigation funding.
platformFollowThrough.Voting Rights: Advocated for federal protections against voter suppression and supported automatic voter registration.
platformFollowThrough.Disaster Recovery: Created the Office of Disaster Recovery and Resilience to support communities impacted by natural disasters.

proposals: Codify protections for Dreamers, expand fusion energy research, and establish national disaster recovery standards.

name: Adam Schiff
bio: Adam Schiff is the junior U.S. Senator from California, elected in 2024 after serving 12 terms in the U.S. House. A former federal prosecutor and chair of the House Intelligence Committee, Schiff gained national prominence as the lead impeachment manager during President Trump’s first trial. He has focused on democracy reform, national security, and economic equity.
education: Stanford University (BA in Political Science), Harvard Law School (JD)
endorsements: End Citizens United, California Democratic Party, Sierra Club
platform: Democracy protection, national security, economic equity, and environmental resilience.

platformFollowThrough.Democracy Protection: Authored the Protecting Our Democracy Act to curb executive overreach and strengthen checks and balances.
platformFollowThrough.National Security: Chaired the House Intelligence Committee and led bipartisan efforts to counter foreign interference.
platformFollowThrough.Economic Equity: Supports raising the minimum wage, expanding affordable housing, and lowering healthcare costs.
platformFollowThrough.Environmental Resilience: Backed legislation to protect wilderness areas and fund climate adaptation infrastructure.

proposals: Ban foreign dark money in elections, expand mental health care access, and invest in earthquake early warning systems.

name: Michael Bennet
bio: Michael Bennet is the senior U.S. Senator from Colorado, appointed in 2009 and subsequently elected to three full terms. A former superintendent of Denver Public Schools, Bennet has focused on education reform, fiscal policy, and bipartisan governance. He ran for president in 2020 and continues to advocate for pragmatic solutions to national challenges.
education: Wesleyan University (BA), Yale Law School (JD)
endorsements: Colorado Education Association, League of Conservation Voters, Third Way
platform: Education reform, fiscal responsibility, climate action, and bipartisan problem-solving.

platformFollowThrough.Education Reform: Introduced legislation to expand early childhood education and improve teacher training programs.
platformFollowThrough.Fiscal Responsibility: Supports balanced budgets and has proposed bipartisan tax reform measures.
platformFollowThrough.Climate Action: Backed clean energy investments and wildfire mitigation funding for Western states.
platformFollowThrough.Bipartisan Problem-Solving: Co-founded the Senate Climate Solutions Caucus and frequently works across the aisle.

proposals: Expand universal pre-K, reform federal student loan repayment, and invest in Western water infrastructure.

name: John Hickenlooper
bio: John Hickenlooper is the junior U.S. Senator from Colorado, elected in 2020 after serving as Governor of Colorado and Mayor of Denver. A former geologist and brewpub owner, Hickenlooper is known for his pragmatic approach to governance and focus on economic development, climate policy, and public health.
education: Wesleyan University (BA in English), Colorado School of Mines (MS in Geology)
endorsements: Colorado Democratic Party, League of Conservation Voters, Planned Parenthood Action Fund
platform: Climate action, economic recovery, public health, and bipartisan reform.

platformFollowThrough.Climate Action: Supports clean energy investments and methane emission reductions; backed legislation to accelerate carbon capture.
platformFollowThrough.Economic Recovery: Advocated for small business relief and infrastructure investment during COVID-19 recovery.
platformFollowThrough.Public Health: Championed mental health funding and opioid treatment expansion.
platformFollowThrough.Bipartisan Reform: Serves on bipartisan working groups and supports filibuster reform for voting rights legislation.

proposals: Expand clean energy tax credits, increase mental health funding, and modernize Western water infrastructure.

name: Richard Blumenthal
bio: Richard Blumenthal is the senior U.S. Senator from Connecticut, serving since 2011. Prior to his Senate career, he was Connecticut’s Attorney General for two decades. Known for his consumer protection work and legal advocacy, Blumenthal has focused on veterans’ issues, tech regulation, and public safety.
education: Harvard University (BA), University of Cambridge, Yale Law School (JD)
endorsements: Connecticut AFL-CIO, Brady Campaign, Sierra Club
platform: Consumer protection, veterans’ services, gun safety, and tech accountability.

platformFollowThrough.Consumer Protection: Sponsored legislation to hold corporations accountable for deceptive practices and data breaches.
platformFollowThrough.Veterans’ Services: Advocated for expanded VA benefits and mental health services for returning service members.
platformFollowThrough.Gun Safety: Supports universal background checks and assault weapons bans; co-sponsored multiple firearm regulation bills.
platformFollowThrough.Tech Accountability: Pushed for stronger antitrust enforcement and privacy protections in digital platforms.

proposals: Ban assault weapons, expand VA mental health care, and regulate AI-driven consumer data collection.

name: Chris Murphy
bio: Chris Murphy is the junior U.S. Senator from Connecticut, elected in 2012 after serving three terms in the U.S. House. He gained national attention for his leadership on gun safety legislation following the Sandy Hook tragedy and has focused on mental health, foreign policy, and democratic reform.
education: Williams College (BA), University of Connecticut School of Law (JD)
endorsements: Brady Campaign, Connecticut Education Association, End Citizens United
platform: Gun safety, mental health, democracy reform, and foreign policy realism.

platformFollowThrough.Gun Safety: Co-authored the Bipartisan Safer Communities Act and led Senate efforts to expand background checks.
platformFollowThrough.Mental Health: Sponsored legislation to increase funding for youth mental health services and school-based care.
platformFollowThrough.Democracy Reform: Supports campaign finance transparency and voting rights protections.
platformFollowThrough.Foreign Policy Realism: Advocates for diplomatic engagement and restraint in military interventions.

proposals: Ban assault weapons, expand school-based mental health programs, and reform campaign finance laws.

name: Lisa Blunt Rochester
bio: Lisa Blunt Rochester is the junior U.S. Senator from Delaware, elected in 2024 after serving four terms in the U.S. House. She is the first woman and first African American to represent Delaware in the Senate. Her career has focused on health equity, economic opportunity, and voting rights.
education: Fairleigh Dickinson University (BA), University of Delaware (MA)
endorsements: EMILY’s List, Congressional Black Caucus PAC, Delaware Democratic Party
platform: Health equity, economic justice, climate resilience, and voting rights.

platformFollowThrough.Health Equity: Supports expanding Medicaid and reducing maternal mortality among women of color.
platformFollowThrough.Economic Justice: Advocates for paid family leave, affordable housing, and workforce development.
platformFollowThrough.Climate Resilience: Backed legislation to protect Delaware’s coastline and invest in clean energy.
platformFollowThrough.Voting Rights: Supports automatic voter registration and restoration of the Voting Rights Act.

proposals: Expand paid leave, protect reproductive rights, and invest in coastal infrastructure.

name: Chris Coons
bio: Chris Coons is the senior U.S. Senator from Delaware, appointed in 2010 and subsequently elected to full terms. A former county executive and attorney, Coons is known for his work on foreign relations, judicial nominations, and bipartisan cooperation. He serves on the Senate Appropriations and Foreign Relations Committees.
education: Amherst College (BA), Yale Divinity School (MA), Yale Law School (JD)
endorsements: Delaware Democratic Party, Human Rights Campaign, Bipartisan Policy Center
platform: Foreign policy, judicial integrity, economic development, and bipartisan governance.

platformFollowThrough.Foreign Policy: Serves on the Senate Foreign Relations Committee and advocates for diplomatic engagement and development aid.
platformFollowThrough.Judicial Integrity: Supports judicial independence and has played a key role in vetting federal nominees.
platformFollowThrough.Economic Development: Backed workforce training programs and small business relief during COVID-19 recovery.
platformFollowThrough.Bipartisan Governance: Frequently works across the aisle and co-chairs bipartisan working groups on climate and manufacturing.

proposals: Expand global health partnerships, support judicial ethics reform, and invest in advanced manufacturing.

name: Ashley B. Moody
bio: Ashley Moody is the junior U.S. Senator from Florida, appointed in January 2025 by Governor Ron DeSantis to fill the vacancy left by Marco Rubio. She previously served as Florida’s Attorney General and as a circuit court judge in Hillsborough County. Moody is known for her legal advocacy, conservative platform, and leadership on law enforcement and consumer protection issues.
education: University of Florida (BS, MS, JD), Stetson University College of Law (LLM in International Law)
endorsements: Florida Police Chiefs Association, National Association of Attorneys General, Florida Chamber of Commerce
platform: Border security, law enforcement support, consumer protection, and anti-trafficking enforcement.

platformFollowThrough.Border Security: Supports increased funding for border enforcement and legislation to expedite removal of criminal aliens.
platformFollowThrough.Law Enforcement Support: Chaired Florida’s Statewide Council on Human Trafficking and led recruitment efforts for police departments.
platformFollowThrough.Consumer Protection: Secured billions for Florida through opioid litigation and fought deceptive trade practices.
platformFollowThrough.Anti-Trafficking Enforcement: Led statewide initiatives to combat human trafficking and prosecute offenders.

proposals: Ban TikTok nationwide, expand federal anti-trafficking task forces, and strengthen penalties for fentanyl distribution.

name: Rick Scott
bio: Rick Scott is the junior U.S. Senator from Florida, elected in 2018 after serving two terms as Governor. A former healthcare executive and Navy veteran, Scott has focused on fiscal conservatism, disaster preparedness, and national security. He serves on the Homeland Security and Armed Services Committees.
education: University of Missouri–Kansas City (BS), Southern Methodist University (JD)
endorsements: National Federation of Independent Business, Florida Realtors, Club for Growth
platform: Fiscal discipline, disaster response, border security, and veterans’ services.

platformFollowThrough.Fiscal Discipline: Proposed the Rescue America plan to reduce federal spending and balance the budget.
platformFollowThrough.Disaster Response: Advocated for hurricane relief funding and improved FEMA coordination.
platformFollowThrough.Border Security: Supports increased border patrol funding and construction of physical barriers.
platformFollowThrough.Veterans’ Services: Backed legislation to expand VA access and reduce wait times for Florida veterans.

proposals: Implement term limits, audit federal agencies annually, and expand hurricane mitigation grants.

name: Jon Ossoff
bio: Jon Ossoff is the junior U.S. Senator from Georgia, elected in 2021 in a historic runoff that helped shift Senate control. A former investigative journalist and media executive, Ossoff has focused on infrastructure, ethics reform, and civil rights. He is the youngest sitting Senator and the first Jewish Senator from Georgia.
education: Georgetown University (BS), London School of Economics (MSc in International Political Economy)
endorsements: Georgia AFL-CIO, Planned Parenthood Action Fund, End Citizens United
platform: Infrastructure, ethics reform, voting rights, and economic equity.

platformFollowThrough.Infrastructure: Secured federal funding for Georgia transit and broadband expansion through the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law.
platformFollowThrough.Ethics Reform: Introduced legislation to ban stock trading by members of Congress and strengthen transparency rules.
platformFollowThrough.Voting Rights: Supports restoration of the Voting Rights Act and federal protections against voter suppression.
platformFollowThrough.Economic Equity: Advocates for affordable housing, student debt relief, and expanded access to healthcare.

proposals: Ban congressional stock trading, expand rural broadband, and codify voting rights protections.

name: Raphael Warnock
bio: Raphael Warnock is the senior U.S. Senator from Georgia, elected in 2021 and reelected in 2022. He is the first Black Senator from Georgia and serves as senior pastor of Ebenezer Baptist Church in Atlanta. Warnock has focused on voting rights, healthcare access, and economic justice.
education: Morehouse College (BA), Union Theological Seminary (MDiv, PhD)
endorsements: Georgia NAACP, Planned Parenthood Action Fund, AFL-CIO
platform: Voting rights, healthcare access, economic justice, and criminal justice reform.

platformFollowThrough.Voting Rights: Sponsored the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act and pushed for federal protections against voter suppression.
platformFollowThrough.Healthcare Access: Supports Medicaid expansion and lowering prescription drug costs.
platformFollowThrough.Economic Justice: Advocated for child tax credit expansion and affordable housing investment.
platformFollowThrough.Criminal Justice Reform: Backed legislation to end cash bail and reduce mandatory minimums for nonviolent offenses.

proposals: Restore voting protections, expand Medicaid, and invest in affordable housing and mental health services.

name: Brian Schatz
bio: Brian Schatz is the senior U.S. Senator from Hawaii, appointed in 2012 and elected to full terms thereafter. He previously served as Hawaii’s Lieutenant Governor and in the state legislature. Schatz is known for his leadership on climate policy, technology, and progressive economic reforms.
education: Pomona College (BA in Philosophy)
endorsements: League of Conservation Voters, Sierra Club, Human Rights Campaign
platform: Climate action, tech innovation, economic equity, and healthcare access.

platformFollowThrough.Climate Action: Introduced the Climate Change Resilience Act and pushed for clean energy investments in island communities.
platformFollowThrough.Tech Innovation: Advocated for net neutrality and broadband expansion across underserved regions.
platformFollowThrough.Economic Equity: Supports raising the minimum wage and expanding the child tax credit.
platformFollowThrough.Healthcare Access: Backed legislation to expand Medicaid and reduce prescription drug costs.

proposals: Create a national climate resilience strategy, regulate AI for consumer protection, and expand rural broadband.

name: Mazie Hirono
bio: Mazie Hirono is the senior U.S. Senator from Hawaii, elected in 2012 after serving in the U.S. House and as Hawaii’s Lieutenant Governor. She is the first Asian American woman elected to the Senate and the first U.S. Senator born in Japan. Hirono is known for her advocacy on immigration, education, and civil rights.
education: University of Hawaii at Mānoa (BA), Georgetown University Law Center (JD)
endorsements: EMILY’s List, Planned Parenthood Action Fund, Asian Pacific American Institute for Congressional Studies
platform: Immigration reform, education access, civil rights, and reproductive freedom.

platformFollowThrough.Immigration Reform: Supports pathway to citizenship for Dreamers and has opposed family separation policies.
platformFollowThrough.Education Access: Advocated for increased federal funding for public schools and student loan forgiveness.
platformFollowThrough.Civil Rights: Championed anti-hate crime legislation and protections for LGBTQ+ Americans.
platformFollowThrough.Reproductive Freedom: Backed federal protections for abortion access and opposed judicial rollbacks of Roe v. Wade.

proposals: Codify abortion rights, expand Pell Grants, and strengthen hate crime enforcement.

name: Mike Crapo
bio: Mike Crapo is the senior U.S. Senator from Idaho, serving since 1999. He previously served in the U.S. House and the Idaho State Senate. Known for his work on tax policy, banking reform, and public lands, Crapo chairs the Senate Finance Committee and is a leading voice on fiscal conservatism.
education: Brigham Young University (BA), Harvard Law School (JD)
endorsements: National Rifle Association, Idaho Farm Bureau, Club for Growth
platform: Tax reform, fiscal responsibility, public lands, and Second Amendment rights.

platformFollowThrough.Tax Reform: Helped craft the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act and advocates for permanent tax relief for families and businesses.
platformFollowThrough.Fiscal Responsibility: Supports balanced budget amendments and reducing federal debt through spending caps.
platformFollowThrough.Public Lands: Backed legislation to expand access to federal lands for recreation and resource development.
platformFollowThrough.Second Amendment Rights: Consistently opposes gun control measures and supports concealed carry reciprocity.

proposals: Make tax cuts permanent, audit federal spending, and expand access to public lands for hunting and recreation.

name: James Risch
bio: James Risch is the junior U.S. Senator from Idaho, elected in 2008 after serving as Governor and Lieutenant Governor. A former prosecutor and state legislator, Risch is known for his work on foreign policy, energy, and national security. He served as Chair of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee and remains a senior member.
education: University of Idaho (BA, JD)
endorsements: National Rifle Association, Idaho Farm Bureau, American Conservative Union
platform: Foreign policy, energy independence, national security, and limited government.

platformFollowThrough.Foreign Policy: Chaired the Senate Foreign Relations Committee and supported sanctions against adversarial regimes.
platformFollowThrough.Energy Independence: Advocates for domestic energy production and reduced reliance on foreign oil.
platformFollowThrough.National Security: Supports increased defense spending and cybersecurity initiatives.
platformFollowThrough.Limited Government: Backs deregulation and reduced federal oversight in agriculture and business.

proposals: Expand domestic energy leases, strengthen sanctions on Iran and Russia, and reduce federal regulatory burdens.

name: Dick Durbin
bio: Dick Durbin is the senior U.S. Senator from Illinois, serving since 1997. He is the Senate Majority Whip and a leading voice on immigration, criminal justice reform, and healthcare. Durbin previously served in the U.S. House and is known for his bipartisan work on judicial nominations and civil liberties.
education: Georgetown University (BA, JD)
endorsements: Planned Parenthood Action Fund, AFL-CIO, Illinois Education Association
platform: Immigration reform, criminal justice, healthcare access, and student debt relief.

platformFollowThrough.Immigration Reform: Co-authored the DREAM Act and continues to advocate for protections for undocumented youth.
platformFollowThrough.Criminal Justice: Supports sentencing reform and rehabilitation programs; backed the First Step Act.
platformFollowThrough.Healthcare Access: Advocates for Medicaid expansion and lowering prescription drug costs.
platformFollowThrough.Student Debt Relief: Supports income-driven repayment plans and Pell Grant expansion.

proposals: Codify DACA protections, expand mental health services, and reform student loan forgiveness programs.

name: Tammy Duckworth
bio: Tammy Duckworth is the junior U.S. Senator from Illinois, elected in 2016 after serving two terms in the U.S. House. A combat veteran and former Assistant Secretary of Veterans Affairs, Duckworth lost both legs in Iraq and has championed disability rights, veterans’ services, and reproductive freedom.
education: University of Hawaii (BA), George Washington University (MA), Capella University (PhD)
endorsements: VoteVets, EMILY’s List, Illinois AFL-CIO
platform: Veterans’ services, disability rights, reproductive freedom, and infrastructure investment.

platformFollowThrough.Veterans’ Services: Sponsored legislation to expand VA access and improve care for women veterans.
platformFollowThrough.Disability Rights: Advocated for increased accessibility in federal programs and public infrastructure.
platformFollowThrough.Reproductive Freedom: Backed federal protections for abortion access and opposed judicial rollbacks.
platformFollowThrough.Infrastructure Investment: Helped secure funding for Illinois transit and clean water upgrades.

proposals: Expand VA maternity care, codify abortion rights, and invest in accessible transit systems.

name: Todd Young
bio: Todd Young is the senior U.S. Senator from Indiana, elected in 2016 after serving in the U.S. House. A former Marine and Naval Academy graduate, Young has focused on economic competitiveness, national security, and bipartisan innovation policy. He co-authored the CHIPS and Science Act to boost domestic semiconductor production.
education: U.S. Naval Academy (BS), University of Chicago (MBA), Indiana University School of Law (JD)
endorsements: Indiana Chamber of Commerce, American Legion, National Federation of Independent Business
platform: Economic competitiveness, national security, innovation, and workforce development.

platformFollowThrough.Economic Competitiveness: Co-authored the CHIPS and Science Act to strengthen U.S. manufacturing and tech leadership.
platformFollowThrough.National Security: Supports increased defense funding and strategic deterrence against China and Russia.
platformFollowThrough.Innovation: Advocated for federal R&D investment and STEM education expansion.
platformFollowThrough.Workforce Development: Backed apprenticeship programs and career training initiatives for Indiana workers.

proposals: Expand STEM education, boost defense manufacturing, and streamline federal innovation grants.

name: Jim Banks
bio: Jim Banks is the junior U.S. Senator from Indiana, elected in 2024 after serving four terms in the U.S. House and previously in the Indiana State Senate. A Navy Reserve officer and former chair of the Republican Study Committee, Banks is known for his conservative stance on national security, education, and cultural issues.
education: Indiana University Bloomington (BA), Grace College and Seminary (MBA)
endorsements: National Right to Life, Club for Growth, Indiana Republican Party
platform: National security, education reform, cultural conservatism, and veterans’ advocacy.

platformFollowThrough.National Security: Supports increased defense spending and sanctions against adversarial regimes.
platformFollowThrough.Education Reform: Advocates for parental rights in education and school choice expansion.
platformFollowThrough.Cultural Conservatism: Opposes DEI mandates and supports restrictions on gender-related medical procedures for minors.
platformFollowThrough.Veterans’ Advocacy: Backed legislation to improve VA services and transition support for returning service members.

proposals: Ban TikTok nationwide, defund DEI programs in federal agencies, and expand school choice funding.

name: Chuck Grassley
bio: Chuck Grassley is the senior U.S. Senator from Iowa, serving since 1981. He is the longest-serving Republican currently in the Senate and has chaired multiple committees, including Judiciary and Finance. Known for his commitment to oversight and transparency, Grassley has focused on agriculture, whistleblower protections, and fiscal accountability.
education: University of Northern Iowa (BA, MA)
endorsements: National Taxpayers Union, Iowa Farm Bureau, American Conservative Union
platform: Agriculture, government oversight, fiscal accountability, and judicial integrity.

platformFollowThrough.Agriculture: Advocated for crop insurance programs and ethanol production incentives.
platformFollowThrough.Government Oversight: Led investigations into federal waste and whistleblower retaliation.
platformFollowThrough.Fiscal Accountability: Supports balanced budgets and audits of federal agencies.
platformFollowThrough.Judicial Integrity: Chaired the Judiciary Committee and oversaw Supreme Court confirmations.

proposals: Strengthen whistleblower protections, expand rural broadband, and audit federal spending programs.

name: Joni Ernst
bio: Joni Ernst is the junior U.S. Senator from Iowa, elected in 2014 as the first woman from the state to serve in Congress. A combat veteran and former state senator, Ernst has focused on agriculture, national defense, and government accountability. She serves on the Armed Services and Agriculture Committees.
education: Iowa State University (BA), Columbus State University (MPA)
endorsements: National Rifle Association, Iowa Farm Bureau, Susan B. Anthony Pro-Life America
platform: Agriculture, national defense, government accountability, and rural infrastructure.

platformFollowThrough.Agriculture: Supports crop insurance programs and ethanol production incentives for Iowa farmers.
platformFollowThrough.National Defense: Advocated for military readiness and veterans’ services; served in the Iowa Army National Guard.
platformFollowThrough.Government Accountability: Introduced legislation to cut wasteful spending and increase transparency.
platformFollowThrough.Rural Infrastructure: Backed broadband expansion and clean water investments for rural communities.

proposals: Ban TikTok on federal devices, expand rural broadband, and streamline military benefits for veterans.

name: Jerry Moran
bio: Jerry Moran is the senior U.S. Senator from Kansas, elected in 2010 after serving seven terms in the U.S. House. A former state senator and attorney, Moran is known for his work on veterans’ affairs, rural health care, and agriculture. He serves on the Appropriations and Veterans’ Affairs Committees.
education: University of Kansas (BA), University of Kansas School of Law (JD)
endorsements: Kansas Farm Bureau, American Legion, National Rifle Association
platform: Veterans’ services, rural health care, agriculture, and fiscal responsibility.

platformFollowThrough.Veterans’ Services: Chairs the Senate Veterans’ Affairs Committee and has led bipartisan efforts to improve VA access.
platformFollowThrough.Rural Health Care: Supports telehealth expansion and funding for rural hospitals.
platformFollowThrough.Agriculture: Advocates for crop insurance programs and trade protections for Kansas farmers.
platformFollowThrough.Fiscal Responsibility: Supports balanced budgets and audits of federal spending.

proposals: Expand rural broadband, improve VA mental health services, and protect agricultural trade routes.

name: Roger Marshall
bio: Roger Marshall is the junior U.S. Senator from Kansas, elected in 2020 after serving two terms in the U.S. House. A practicing obstetrician and Army veteran, Marshall has focused on rural health care, agriculture, and conservative cultural issues. He serves on the Agriculture and Health Committees.
education: Kansas State University (BS), University of Kansas School of Medicine (MD)
endorsements: National Right to Life, Kansas Farm Bureau, American Medical Association PAC
platform: Rural health care, agriculture, border security, and cultural conservatism.

platformFollowThrough.Rural Health Care: Advocated for telehealth expansion and rural hospital funding.
platformFollowThrough.Agriculture: Supports crop insurance programs and trade protections for Kansas producers.
platformFollowThrough.Border Security: Backed legislation to increase border patrol funding and restrict asylum loopholes.
platformFollowThrough.Cultural Conservatism: Opposes DEI mandates and supports restrictions on gender-related procedures for minors.

proposals: Ban TikTok nationwide, defund DEI programs, and expand rural maternity care access.

name: Mitch McConnell
bio: Mitch McConnell is the senior U.S. Senator from Kentucky and the longest-serving Senate party leader in U.S. history. First elected in 1984, he has held leadership roles including Majority Leader and Minority Leader. McConnell is known for his influence on judicial appointments, tax policy, and Senate procedure.
education: University of Louisville (BA), University of Kentucky College of Law (JD)
endorsements: National Right to Life, U.S. Chamber of Commerce, Kentucky Republican Party
platform: Judicial appointments, tax reform, national security, and Senate institutional integrity.

platformFollowThrough.Judicial Appointments: Oversaw confirmation of hundreds of federal judges, including three Supreme Court justices.
platformFollowThrough.Tax Reform: Championed the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of 2017.
platformFollowThrough.National Security: Supports increased defense spending and sanctions against adversarial regimes.
platformFollowThrough.Senate Integrity: Defended filibuster rules and institutional norms during partisan shifts.

proposals: Preserve Senate filibuster, expand sanctions on China and Russia, and maintain tax relief for businesses.

name: Rand Paul
bio: Rand Paul is the junior U.S. Senator from Kentucky, elected in 2010. A practicing ophthalmologist and son of former Congressman Ron Paul, he is known for his libertarian-leaning views on civil liberties, fiscal policy, and foreign intervention. Paul serves on the Homeland Security and Health Committees.
education: Baylor University (attended), Duke University School of Medicine (MD)
endorsements: National Taxpayers Union, Young Americans for Liberty, Kentucky Right to Life
platform: Civil liberties, fiscal restraint, non-interventionist foreign policy, and healthcare freedom.

platformFollowThrough.Civil Liberties: Opposed warrantless surveillance and supported criminal justice reform.
platformFollowThrough.Fiscal Restraint: Proposed balanced budget amendments and criticized deficit spending.
platformFollowThrough.Foreign Policy: Opposed military aid and intervention in foreign conflicts.
platformFollowThrough.Healthcare Freedom: Advocated for deregulating medical practice and expanding health savings accounts.

proposals: Audit the Federal Reserve, end foreign aid to adversaries, and expand direct-pay healthcare models.

name: Bill Cassidy
bio: Bill Cassidy is the senior U.S. Senator from Louisiana, elected in 2014 after serving three terms in the U.S. House. A physician by training, Cassidy has focused on healthcare policy, disaster recovery, and energy development. He serves on the Health, Energy, and Finance Committees.
education: Louisiana State University (BS, MD)
endorsements: American Medical Association PAC, Louisiana Oil & Gas Association, National Federation of Independent Business
platform: Healthcare reform, energy development, disaster recovery, and fiscal responsibility.

platformFollowThrough.Healthcare Reform: Co-authored the Cassidy-Graham bill to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act.
platformFollowThrough.Energy Development: Supports offshore drilling and natural gas expansion in the Gulf region.
platformFollowThrough.Disaster Recovery: Advocated for federal aid and infrastructure rebuilding after hurricanes and floods.
platformFollowThrough.Fiscal Responsibility: Supports balanced budgets and reducing federal deficits.

proposals: Expand health savings accounts, streamline disaster relief funding, and boost domestic energy production.

name: John Kennedy
bio: John Kennedy is the junior U.S. Senator from Louisiana, elected in 2016 after serving as State Treasurer and in multiple legal and academic roles. Known for his colorful rhetoric and conservative positions, Kennedy focuses on crime, fiscal policy, and government accountability.
education: Vanderbilt University (BA), University of Virginia School of Law (JD), Oxford University (BCL)
endorsements: National Rifle Association, Louisiana Sheriffs’ Association, Club for Growth
platform: Crime prevention, fiscal conservatism, government accountability, and energy independence.

platformFollowThrough.Crime Prevention: Supports increased funding for law enforcement and harsher penalties for violent offenders.
platformFollowThrough.Fiscal Conservatism: Advocates for balanced budgets and reduced federal spending.
platformFollowThrough.Government Accountability: Backed legislation to audit federal agencies and eliminate waste.
platformFollowThrough.Energy Independence: Supports offshore drilling and domestic energy production in the Gulf region.

proposals: Defund sanctuary cities, expand oil and gas leases, and audit federal regulatory agencies.

name: Susan Collins
bio: Susan Collins is the senior U.S. Senator from Maine, serving since 1997. Known for her centrist positions and bipartisan approach, she has played key roles in healthcare, appropriations, and judicial confirmations. Collins is one of the most senior women in the Senate and chairs the Aging Committee.
education: St. Lawrence University (BA)
endorsements: League of Women Voters of Maine, Maine Association of Realtors, American Hospital Association
platform: Bipartisanship, healthcare access, senior services, and infrastructure investment.

platformFollowThrough.Bipartisanship: Frequently works across the aisle and helped negotiate COVID relief packages.
platformFollowThrough.Healthcare Access: Supports protections for pre-existing conditions and rural hospital funding.
platformFollowThrough.Senior Services: Chairs the Aging Committee and advocates for elder care and retirement security.
platformFollowThrough.Infrastructure Investment: Backed bipartisan infrastructure law and rural broadband expansion.

proposals: Expand elder care funding, protect rural hospitals, and strengthen bipartisan budget negotiations.

name: Angus King
bio: Angus King is the junior U.S. Senator from Maine, elected as an Independent in 2012 after serving two terms as Governor. He caucuses with Democrats and is known for his pragmatic approach to cybersecurity, energy policy, and government reform. King serves on the Intelligence and Armed Services Committees.
education: Dartmouth College (BA), University of Virginia School of Law (JD)
endorsements: League of Conservation Voters, AARP Maine, Maine Education Association
platform: Cybersecurity, clean energy, government reform, and bipartisan problem-solving.

platformFollowThrough.Cybersecurity: Advocated for stronger national cyber defenses and modernization of federal IT systems.
platformFollowThrough.Clean Energy: Supports offshore wind development and carbon reduction initiatives.
platformFollowThrough.Government Reform: Backed campaign finance transparency and bipartisan budget negotiations.
platformFollowThrough.Bipartisan Problem-Solving: Works across party lines on infrastructure, veterans’ care, and rural broadband.

proposals: Create a national cyber strategy, expand clean energy tax credits, and reform campaign finance laws.

name: Angela Alsobrooks
bio: Angela Alsobrooks is the junior U.S. Senator from Maryland, elected in 2024 after serving as Prince George’s County Executive. A former prosecutor and community leader, Alsobrooks has focused on public safety, federal workforce protections, and reproductive rights. She is one of the newest members of the Senate Democratic caucus.
education: Duke University (BA), University of Maryland School of Law (JD)
endorsements: EMILY’s List, Maryland State Education Association, Planned Parenthood Action Fund
platform: Public safety, reproductive rights, federal workforce protections, and economic equity.

platformFollowThrough.Public Safety: Introduced legislation to support federal workers during government shutdowns and improve community policing.
platformFollowThrough.Reproductive Rights: Supports codifying Roe v. Wade and expanding access to reproductive healthcare.
platformFollowThrough.Federal Workforce Protections: Co-sponsored the Help FEDS Act to ensure pay continuity during shutdowns.
platformFollowThrough.Economic Equity: Advocates for affordable housing, workforce development, and small business support.

proposals: Codify abortion rights, protect federal workers from shutdown impacts, and expand housing affordability programs.

name: Chris Van Hollen
bio: Chris Van Hollen is the junior U.S. Senator from Maryland, elected in 2016 after serving seven terms in the U.S. House. A former state legislator and budget expert, Van Hollen focuses on economic equity, climate policy, and democratic reform. He serves on the Appropriations and Foreign Relations Committees.
education: Swarthmore College (BA), Harvard Kennedy School (MPP), Georgetown University Law Center (JD)
endorsements: Sierra Club, AFL-CIO, End Citizens United
platform: Economic equity, climate action, democratic reform, and global diplomacy.

platformFollowThrough.Economic Equity: Supports expanded tax credits for working families and student debt relief.
platformFollowThrough.Climate Action: Backed clean energy investments and carbon pricing proposals.
platformFollowThrough.Democratic Reform: Advocates for voting rights protections and campaign finance transparency.
platformFollowThrough.Global Diplomacy: Supports foreign aid and multilateral engagement to counter authoritarian regimes.

proposals: Expand child tax credit, pass climate resilience legislation, and restore the Voting Rights Act.

name: Elizabeth Warren
bio: Elizabeth Warren is the senior U.S. Senator from Massachusetts, elected in 2012 after a career as a law professor and consumer advocate. A leading progressive voice, she has focused on financial regulation, student debt relief, and corporate accountability. Warren ran for president in 2020 and serves on the Banking and Finance Committees.
education: University of Houston (BS), Rutgers University School of Law (JD)
endorsements: Working Families Party, MoveOn, Massachusetts Teachers Association
platform: Consumer protection, student debt relief, corporate accountability, and economic justice.

platformFollowThrough.Consumer Protection: Helped establish the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and continues to advocate for stronger oversight.
platformFollowThrough.Student Debt Relief: Supports broad cancellation of federal student loans and income-driven repayment reforms.
platformFollowThrough.Corporate Accountability: Proposed legislation to break up monopolies and increase corporate transparency.
platformFollowThrough.Economic Justice: Advocates for wealth taxes and expanded social safety net programs.

proposals: Cancel up to $50,000 in student debt, implement a wealth tax, and strengthen antitrust enforcement.

name: Edward Markey
bio: Edward Markey is the junior U.S. Senator from Massachusetts, elected in a 2013 special election after serving 37 years in the U.S. House. A leading progressive on climate and technology, Markey co-authored the Green New Deal and has focused on net neutrality, environmental justice, and youth engagement.
education: Boston College (BA, JD)
endorsements: Sunrise Movement, Sierra Club, Massachusetts Teachers Association
platform: Climate action, tech regulation, youth engagement, and economic justice.

platformFollowThrough.Climate Action: Co-authored the Green New Deal and supports aggressive carbon reduction targets.
platformFollowThrough.Tech Regulation: Advocates for net neutrality, data privacy, and broadband expansion.
platformFollowThrough.Youth Engagement: Backed legislation to lower voting age in federal elections and expand student aid.
platformFollowThrough.Economic Justice: Supports wealth taxes, universal healthcare, and affordable housing initiatives.

proposals: Enact Green New Deal provisions, restore net neutrality, and expand Pell Grant eligibility.

name: Gary Peters
bio: Gary Peters is the junior U.S. Senator from Michigan, elected in 2014 after serving in the U.S. House and Michigan State Senate. A former Navy Reserve officer and business analyst, Peters is known for his work on homeland security, infrastructure, and environmental protection. He chairs the Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee.
education: Alma College (BA), University of Detroit Mercy (MBA), Wayne State University (JD)
endorsements: League of Conservation Voters, Michigan AFL-CIO, Sierra Club
platform: Homeland security, infrastructure, environmental protection, and veterans’ services.

platformFollowThrough.Homeland Security: Chairs the Senate committee and led bipartisan efforts to improve cybersecurity and disaster response.
platformFollowThrough.Infrastructure: Backed major investments in roads, bridges, and broadband expansion across Michigan.
platformFollowThrough.Environmental Protection: Supports clean water initiatives and PFAS contamination cleanup.
platformFollowThrough.Veterans’ Services: Advocated for expanded mental health care and transition support for veterans.

proposals: Strengthen cyber defenses, expand clean water funding, and improve federal disaster coordination.

name: Elissa Slotkin
bio: Elissa Slotkin is the junior U.S. Senator from Michigan, elected in 2024 after serving three terms in the U.S. House. A former CIA analyst and national security official, Slotkin has focused on bipartisan legislation around economic development, environmental protection, and public health. She serves on the Armed Services, Homeland Security, Agriculture, and Veterans’ Affairs Committees.
education: Cornell University (BA), Columbia University (MIA)
endorsements: League of Conservation Voters, Michigan Education Association, VoteVets
platform: National security, economic development, environmental protection, and healthcare affordability.

platformFollowThrough.National Security: Co-led the Great Lakes Restoration Initiative Act and supported cybersecurity modernization.
platformFollowThrough.Economic Development: Introduced the Tax Cut for Workers Act to expand earned income credits.
platformFollowThrough.Environmental Protection: Backed full funding for the Flint Registry and PFAS cleanup efforts.
platformFollowThrough.Healthcare Affordability: Sponsored the Health Care Affordability Act to expand coverage credits.

proposals: Codify secure firearm storage laws, expand refundable health coverage credits, and boost Great Lakes funding.

name: Amy Klobuchar
bio: Amy Klobuchar is the senior U.S. Senator from Minnesota, first elected in 2006. A former prosecutor and Senate Democratic Steering Committee Chair, Klobuchar is known for her bipartisan work on antitrust, election security, and consumer protection. She ran for president in 2020 and remains a leading voice on tech regulation and rural investment.
education: Yale University (BA), University of Chicago Law School (JD)
endorsements: League of Women Voters of Minnesota, Minnesota Farmers Union, American Association for Justice
platform: Antitrust enforcement, election security, rural broadband, and consumer protection.

platformFollowThrough.Antitrust Enforcement: Chairs the Senate Antitrust Subcommittee and led bipartisan efforts to rein in tech monopolies.
platformFollowThrough.Election Security: Sponsored legislation to modernize voting infrastructure and protect against foreign interference.
platformFollowThrough.Rural Broadband: Backed major investments in broadband access for underserved communities.
platformFollowThrough.Consumer Protection: Advocated for airline passenger rights and prescription drug pricing reforms.

proposals: Ban junk fees, expand rural broadband grants, and strengthen antitrust enforcement against tech giants.

name: Tina Smith
bio: Tina Smith is the junior U.S. Senator from Minnesota, appointed in 2018 and elected later that year. A former lieutenant governor and Planned Parenthood executive, Smith has focused on mental health, reproductive rights, and rural development. She serves on the Health, Agriculture, and Banking Committees.
education: Stanford University (BA), Dartmouth College (MBA)
endorsements: Planned Parenthood Action Fund, Minnesota Nurses Association, EMILY’s List
platform: Mental health care, reproductive rights, rural development, and economic equity.

platformFollowThrough.Mental Health Care: Introduced bipartisan legislation to expand access to mental health services in schools and rural areas.
platformFollowThrough.Reproductive Rights: Supports codifying Roe v. Wade and expanding access to contraception.
platformFollowThrough.Rural Development: Backed funding for broadband expansion and rural housing programs.
platformFollowThrough.Economic Equity: Advocates for paid family leave and affordable childcare.

proposals: Expand school-based mental health programs, codify abortion rights, and boost rural housing grants.

name: Roger Wicker
bio: Roger Wicker is the senior U.S. Senator from Mississippi, appointed in 2007 and subsequently elected to full terms. A former U.S. Representative and Air Force officer, Wicker has focused on defense, telecommunications, and infrastructure. He serves on the Armed Services and Commerce Committees and has held multiple leadership roles.
education: University of Mississippi (BA, JD)
endorsements: Mississippi Farm Bureau, National Rifle Association, American Legion
platform: Defense spending, broadband expansion, infrastructure investment, and conservative judicial appointments.

platformFollowThrough.Defense Spending: Advocated for increased military funding and modernization of naval assets.
platformFollowThrough.Broadband Expansion: Supports rural broadband initiatives and telecom deregulation.
platformFollowThrough.Infrastructure Investment: Backed highway and port development projects across Mississippi.
platformFollowThrough.Judicial Appointments: Consistently supports conservative nominees to federal courts.

proposals: Boost naval shipbuilding, expand rural broadband grants, and streamline federal infrastructure permitting.

name: Cindy Hyde-Smith
bio: Cindy Hyde-Smith is the junior U.S. Senator from Mississippi, appointed in 2018 and elected later that year. She previously served as Mississippi’s Commissioner of Agriculture and in the State Senate. Hyde-Smith focuses on agriculture, rural development, and conservative social policy, and serves on the Agriculture and Appropriations Committees.
education: University of Southern Mississippi (BA)
endorsements: Mississippi Farm Bureau, National Right to Life, Susan B. Anthony Pro-Life America
platform: Agriculture, rural infrastructure, pro-life policy, and Second Amendment rights.

platformFollowThrough.Agriculture: Supports farm subsidies and disaster relief for agricultural producers.
platformFollowThrough.Rural Infrastructure: Advocated for broadband expansion and rural health clinic funding.
platformFollowThrough.Pro-Life Policy: Backed legislation restricting federal funding for abortion services.
platformFollowThrough.Second Amendment: Opposes gun control measures and supports concealed carry reciprocity.

proposals: Expand crop insurance programs, restrict federal abortion funding, and increase rural hospital grants.

name: Josh Hawley
bio: Josh Hawley is the senior U.S. Senator from Missouri, elected in 2018 after serving as the state’s Attorney General. A constitutional lawyer and former Supreme Court clerk, Hawley is known for his populist conservatism, focus on tech regulation, and cultural issues. He serves on the Judiciary and Armed Services Committees.
education: Stanford University (BA), Yale Law School (JD)
endorsements: National Right to Life, Susan B. Anthony Pro-Life America, Family Research Council
platform: Tech accountability, religious liberty, border security, and economic nationalism.

platformFollowThrough.Tech Accountability: Introduced legislation to limit Section 230 protections and break up Big Tech monopolies.
platformFollowThrough.Religious Liberty: Supports protections for faith-based organizations and religious expression in public life.
platformFollowThrough.Border Security: Backed increased funding for border enforcement and opposed sanctuary policies.
platformFollowThrough.Economic Nationalism: Advocates for reshoring manufacturing and protecting American workers from global competition.

proposals: Ban TikTok nationwide, restrict foreign land ownership, and expand parental rights in education.

name: Eric Schmitt
bio: Eric Schmitt is the junior U.S. Senator from Missouri, elected in 2022 after serving as the state’s Attorney General and Treasurer. Known for his legal activism and conservative positions, Schmitt has focused on federal overreach, energy policy, and border enforcement. He serves on the Judiciary, Armed Services, and Energy Committees.
education: Truman State University (BA), Saint Louis University School of Law (JD)
endorsements: National Federation of Independent Business, Missouri Farm Bureau, National Rifle Association
platform: Federalism, energy independence, border security, and constitutional rights.

platformFollowThrough.Federalism: Filed lawsuits challenging federal mandates and executive overreach.
platformFollowThrough.Energy Independence: Supports expanded domestic drilling and pipeline development.
platformFollowThrough.Border Security: Backed legislation to increase border patrol funding and restrict asylum loopholes.
platformFollowThrough.Constitutional Rights: Advocates for Second Amendment protections and limits on federal surveillance.

proposals: Defund sanctuary cities, expand domestic energy production, and restrict federal regulatory authority.

name: Tim Sheehy
bio: Tim Sheehy is the junior U.S. Senator from Montana, elected in 2024 after defeating three-term incumbent Jon Tester. A former Navy SEAL and founder of Bridger Aerospace, Sheehy is focused on border security, energy independence, and reducing federal oversight. He is the youngest Republican in the Senate and serves on the Armed Services, Commerce, and Veterans’ Affairs Committees.
education: United States Naval Academy (BS)
endorsements: National Rifle Association, Montana Farm Bureau Federation, Club for Growth
platform: Border security, energy independence, education reform, and federal deregulation.

platformFollowThrough.Border Security: Advocated for construction of a border wall and increased funding for enforcement agencies.
platformFollowThrough.Energy Independence: Supports expanded domestic fossil fuel and renewable energy production.
platformFollowThrough.Education Reform: Proposed eliminating the Department of Education to return control to states.
platformFollowThrough.Federal Deregulation: Backed legislation to reduce federal oversight and streamline permitting.

proposals: Eliminate Department of Education, expand aerial firefighting programs, and restrict federal land acquisition.
billsSigned: S.160: Aerial Firefighting Enhancement Act of 2025

name: Steve Daines
bio: Steve Daines is the senior U.S. Senator from Montana, elected in 2014 after serving one term in the U.S. House. A former technology executive, Daines focuses on energy development, public lands, and conservative economic policy. He serves on the Finance, Energy, and Indian Affairs Committees and chairs the National Republican Senatorial Committee.
education: Montana State University (BS)
endorsements: National Rifle Association, Montana Chamber of Commerce, Right to Life of Montana
platform: Energy development, tax reform, public lands access, and border security.

platformFollowThrough.Energy Development: Supports expanded oil, gas, and coal production and opposed Biden-era restrictions.
platformFollowThrough.Tax Reform: Backed the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act and supports small business incentives.
platformFollowThrough.Public Lands Access: Advocates for hunting, fishing, and recreation access on federal lands.
platformFollowThrough.Border Security: Supports increased enforcement and construction of physical barriers.

proposals: Expand domestic energy leases, simplify tax code for small businesses, and increase border patrol funding.

name: Deb Fischer
bio: Deb Fischer is the senior U.S. Senator from Nebraska, elected in 2012 after serving in the state legislature. A rancher and former chair of the Transportation Committee, Fischer focuses on agriculture, infrastructure, and national defense. She is the highest-ranking Republican woman on the Senate Armed Services Committee.
education: University of Nebraska–Lincoln (BS)
endorsements: Nebraska Farm Bureau, National Rifle Association, American Legion
platform: Agriculture, infrastructure, national defense, and rural development.

platformFollowThrough.Agriculture: Supports farm subsidies, crop insurance, and trade protections for Nebraska producers.
platformFollowThrough.Infrastructure: Backed highway and rail modernization bills and rural broadband expansion.
platformFollowThrough.National Defense: Advocated for increased military funding and modernization of nuclear deterrence.
platformFollowThrough.Rural Development: Supports rural health clinics, housing programs, and education access.

proposals: Expand rural broadband, modernize nuclear triad, and increase funding for agricultural research.

name: Pete Ricketts
bio: Pete Ricketts is the junior U.S. Senator from Nebraska, appointed in 2023 following the resignation of Ben Sasse. A former two-term governor and businessman, Ricketts focuses on agriculture, tax policy, and conservative governance. He serves on the Agriculture, Environment, and Budget Committees.
education: University of Chicago (BA, MBA)
endorsements: Nebraska Cattlemen, National Right to Life, Americans for Prosperity
platform: Agricultural growth, tax cuts, conservative values, and regulatory rollback.

platformFollowThrough.Agricultural Growth: Supports trade expansion and reduced regulation for Nebraska producers.
platformFollowThrough.Tax Cuts: Advocates for lower income and corporate tax rates.
platformFollowThrough.Conservative Values: Backed pro-life legislation and religious liberty protections.
platformFollowThrough.Regulatory Rollback: Supports reducing federal oversight in energy, education, and healthcare.

proposals: Cut federal income tax rates, expand agricultural exports, and eliminate ESG mandates in federal programs.

name: Jacky Rosen
bio: Jacky Rosen is the junior U.S. Senator from Nevada, elected in 2018 after serving one term in the U.S. House. A former computer programmer and synagogue president, Rosen is known for her bipartisan approach to cybersecurity, workforce development, and veterans’ issues. She serves on the Armed Services, Foreign Relations, Commerce, and Small Business Committees.
education: University of Minnesota (BA), Clark County Community College (AAS)
endorsements: League of Women Voters of Nevada, AARP Nevada, American Federation of Teachers
platform: Cybersecurity, workforce development, veterans’ services, and bipartisan governance.

platformFollowThrough.Cybersecurity: Championed legislation to strengthen cyber defenses and protect critical infrastructure.
platformFollowThrough.Workforce Development: Supports STEM education and apprenticeship programs for emerging industries.
platformFollowThrough.Veterans’ Services: Backed expanded mental health care and housing support for veterans.
platformFollowThrough.Bipartisan Governance: Named one of the most effective and bipartisan senators in multiple rankings.

proposals: Expand cybersecurity grants, increase funding for STEM apprenticeships, and improve VA service delivery.
billsSigned: S.3448: Never Again Education Reauthorization Act of 2023

name: Catherine Cortez Masto
bio: Catherine Cortez Masto is the senior U.S. Senator from Nevada, elected in 2016 as the first Latina in Senate history. A former Nevada Attorney General, she focuses on consumer protection, public lands, and immigration reform. She serves on the Banking, Energy, and Indian Affairs Committees.
education: University of Nevada, Reno (BA), Gonzaga University School of Law (JD)
endorsements: Planned Parenthood Action Fund, League of Conservation Voters, Latino Victory Fund
platform: Consumer protection, immigration reform, public lands access, and women's rights.

platformFollowThrough.Consumer Protection: Advocated for stronger data privacy laws and protections against predatory lending.
platformFollowThrough.Immigration Reform: Supports pathway to citizenship and protections for Dreamers.
platformFollowThrough.Public Lands Access: Opposes privatization and supports conservation funding.
platformFollowThrough.Women’s Rights: Backed legislation to expand reproductive healthcare and workplace protections.

proposals: Strengthen consumer data protections, codify Roe v. Wade, and expand conservation grants for public lands.
billsSigned: S.366: Data Privacy and Protection Act of 2025

name: Jeanne Shaheen
bio: Jeanne Shaheen is the senior U.S. Senator from New Hampshire, elected in 2008 after serving as Governor and state legislator. She is the first woman in U.S. history to be elected both Governor and U.S. Senator. Shaheen focuses on energy policy, small business support, and women’s rights, and serves on the Appropriations and Foreign Relations Committees.
education: University of Mississippi (BA), University of Mississippi (MA)
endorsements: Planned Parenthood Action Fund, League of Conservation Voters, New Hampshire Women’s Foundation
platform: Energy innovation, small business growth, women’s rights, and foreign policy leadership.

platformFollowThrough.Energy Innovation: Supports clean energy research and offshore wind development.
platformFollowThrough.Small Business Growth: Championed SBA loan expansion and rural entrepreneurship programs.
platformFollowThrough.Women’s Rights: Backed legislation for reproductive healthcare and workplace equality.
platformFollowThrough.Foreign Policy Leadership: Advocates for NATO support and global democratic alliances.

proposals: Expand SBA lending, codify reproductive rights, and increase funding for clean energy innovation.

name: Maggie Hassan
bio: Maggie Hassan is the junior U.S. Senator from New Hampshire, elected in 2016 after serving as Governor and state senator. She is known for her bipartisan work on education, opioid response, and veterans’ services. Hassan serves on the Finance, Health, Homeland Security, and Veterans’ Affairs Committees.
education: Brown University (BA), Northeastern University School of Law (JD)
endorsements: End Citizens United, New Hampshire Education Association, EMILY’s List
platform: Education access, opioid crisis response, veterans’ services, and bipartisan fiscal policy.

platformFollowThrough.Education Access: Backed expanded Pell Grants and career training programs.
platformFollowThrough.Opioid Crisis Response: Championed funding for treatment centers and overdose prevention.
platformFollowThrough.Veterans’ Services: Sponsored legislation to improve VA transparency and rural access.
platformFollowThrough.Bipartisan Fiscal Policy: Worked across the aisle on budget reform and infrastructure funding.

proposals: Increase Pell Grant funding, expand opioid treatment access, and improve rural VA services.

name: Andrew Kim
bio: Andrew Kim is the junior U.S. Senator from New Jersey, appointed in December 2024 after winning the general election. A former three-term U.S. Representative and national security advisor, Kim is known for his focus on anti-corruption, veterans’ services, and foreign policy. He serves on the Banking, Commerce, Health, and Aging Committees.
education: University of Chicago (BA), University of Oxford (MPhil, DPhil)
endorsements: End Citizens United, VoteVets, New Jersey Working Families Alliance
platform: Anti-corruption, veterans’ services, economic fairness, and foreign policy reform.

platformFollowThrough.Anti-Corruption: Ran on a reform platform and pledged to reject corporate PAC money.
platformFollowThrough.Veterans’ Services: Supports expanded mental health care and housing for veterans.
platformFollowThrough.Economic Fairness: Advocates for middle-class tax relief and student loan reform.
platformFollowThrough.Foreign Policy Reform: Draws on national security experience to promote diplomacy and global stability.

proposals: Ban corporate PAC contributions, expand VA mental health programs, and reform student loan repayment.

name: Cory Booker
bio: Cory Booker is the senior U.S. Senator from New Jersey, elected in a 2013 special election after serving as Mayor of Newark. Known for his passionate oratory and progressive advocacy, Booker focuses on criminal justice reform, economic opportunity, and civil rights. He serves on the Judiciary, Foreign Relations, and Environment Committees.
education: Stanford University (BA, MA), University of Oxford (Rhodes Scholar), Yale Law School (JD)
endorsements: NAACP, Human Rights Campaign, Sierra Club
platform: Criminal justice reform, economic justice, climate action, and civil rights.

platformFollowThrough.Criminal Justice Reform: Sponsored the First Step Act and legislation to end solitary confinement for juveniles.
platformFollowThrough.Economic Justice: Advocated for baby bonds and expanded earned income tax credits.
platformFollowThrough.Climate Action: Supports Green New Deal principles and clean energy investment.
platformFollowThrough.Civil Rights: Championed voting rights protections and police accountability reforms.

proposals: Create baby bonds for every child, ban solitary confinement for minors, and expand voting rights protections.
billsSigned: S.597: Police Accountability and Community Safety Act

name: Ben Ray Luján
bio: Ben Ray Luján is the junior U.S. Senator from New Mexico, elected in 2020 after serving six terms in the U.S. House. He previously chaired the Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee and is known for his work on broadband access, health equity, and clean energy. He serves on the Commerce, Health, and Indian Affairs Committees.
education: New Mexico Highlands University (BA)
endorsements: League of Conservation Voters, AARP New Mexico, National Education Association
platform: Broadband expansion, health equity, clean energy, and tribal advocacy.

platformFollowThrough.Broadband Expansion: Championed legislation to expand rural internet access across New Mexico.
platformFollowThrough.Health Equity: Supports funding for community health centers and mental health services.
platformFollowThrough.Clean Energy: Advocates for solar and wind investment and transition away from fossil fuels.
platformFollowThrough.Tribal Advocacy: Backed increased funding for tribal education and healthcare programs.

proposals: Expand rural broadband grants, increase funding for community health centers, and boost clean energy tax credits.

name: Martin Heinrich
bio: Martin Heinrich is the senior U.S. Senator from New Mexico, elected in 2012 after serving in the U.S. House and Albuquerque City Council. An engineer and conservationist, Heinrich focuses on clean energy, public lands, and technology innovation. He serves on the Energy, Intelligence, and Appropriations Committees.
education: University of Missouri (BS)
endorsements: League of Conservation Voters, Sierra Club, New Mexico Wildlife Federation
platform: Clean energy, public lands, technology innovation, and tribal partnerships.

platformFollowThrough.Clean Energy: Championed legislation to expand solar, wind, and battery storage investments.
platformFollowThrough.Public Lands: Opposes privatization and supports conservation and recreation access.
platformFollowThrough.Technology Innovation: Advocates for STEM education and federal R&D funding.
platformFollowThrough.Tribal Partnerships: Supports tribal sovereignty and infrastructure investment.

proposals: Expand clean energy tax credits, increase STEM education funding, and protect national monuments from development.
billsSigned: S.222: Clean Energy Workforce Development Act

name: Chuck Schumer
bio: Chuck Schumer is the senior U.S. Senator from New York and the Senate Majority Leader. First elected in 1998 after serving in the U.S. House and New York State Assembly, Schumer is known for his leadership on economic policy, judicial nominations, and infrastructure investment. He plays a central role in shaping the Senate’s legislative agenda.
education: Harvard College (BA), Harvard Law School (JD)
endorsements: Planned Parenthood Action Fund, AFL-CIO, League of Conservation Voters
platform: Economic recovery, infrastructure modernization, judicial appointments, and public safety.

platformFollowThrough.Economic Recovery: Led passage of COVID relief packages and supports middle-class tax relief.
platformFollowThrough.Infrastructure Modernization: Championed the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law and Amtrak expansion.
platformFollowThrough.Judicial Appointments: Oversaw confirmation of federal judges aligned with Democratic priorities.
platformFollowThrough.Public Safety: Supports gun safety legislation and community policing reforms.
