name: Jim Justice
bio: Jim Justice is the junior U.S. Senator from West Virginia, elected in 2024 after serving two terms as Governor. A billionaire coal magnate turned public servant, Justice is known for his populist style, economic development focus, and signature appearances with his English bulldog, Babydog. He serves on the Energy, Budget, and Veterans’ Affairs Committees.
education: Marshall University (BA, MBA)
endorsements: West Virginia Chamber of Commerce, National Mining Association, American Farm Bureau Federation
platform: Economic development, energy independence, rural revitalization, and government transparency.

platformFollowThrough.Economic Development: Championed tourism, infrastructure, and surplus-driven budgeting as Governor.
platformFollowThrough.Energy Independence: Supports coal, natural gas, and domestic energy production.
platformFollowThrough.Rural Revitalization: Advocates for broadband expansion and rural health care access.
platformFollowThrough.Government Transparency: Opposes bureaucratic gridlock and promotes direct communication with constituents.

proposals: Eliminate state income tax, expand coal subsidies, and increase rural hospital funding.

name: Shelley Moore Capito
bio: Shelley Moore Capito is the senior U.S. Senator from West Virginia, elected in 2014 after seven terms in the U.S. House. The first woman elected to the Senate from West Virginia, Capito focuses on infrastructure, broadband, energy, and opioid recovery. She serves on the Appropriations, Environment, and Rules Committees.
education: Duke University (BA), University of Virginia (MA)
endorsements: West Virginia Hospital Association, American Road & Transportation Builders Association, National Federation of Independent Business
platform: Infrastructure, broadband expansion, energy policy, and opioid recovery.

platformFollowThrough.Infrastructure: Championed bipartisan highway and water system funding.
platformFollowThrough.Broadband Expansion: Led efforts to close the digital divide in rural areas.
platformFollowThrough.Energy Policy: Supports coal and natural gas development with environmental safeguards.
platformFollowThrough.Opioid Recovery: Backed treatment funding and prevention programs statewide.

proposals: Expand rural broadband grants, increase opioid treatment funding, and modernize water infrastructure.
billsSigned: S.1453: Rural Connectivity and Infrastructure Act
S.1320: Opioid Recovery and Treatment Expansion Act

name: Tammy Baldwin
bio: Tammy Baldwin is the senior U.S. Senator from Wisconsin, elected in 2012 after serving seven terms in the U.S. House. The first openly LGBTQ+ Senator, Baldwin is known for her advocacy on health care, manufacturing, and civil rights. She serves on the Appropriations, Health, and Commerce Committees.
education: Smith College (BA), University of Wisconsin Law School (JD)
endorsements: Human Rights Campaign, AFL-CIO, Planned Parenthood Action Fund
platform: Health care access, Made in America manufacturing, LGBTQ+ rights, and economic fairness.

platformFollowThrough.Health Care Access: Supports public option and mental health parity.
platformFollowThrough.Made in America: Championed Buy American provisions and manufacturing tax credits.
platformFollowThrough.LGBTQ+ Rights: Advocated for Equality Act and anti-discrimination protections.
platformFollowThrough.Economic Fairness: Backed student debt relief and fair wage legislation.

proposals: Create a public health insurance option, expand Buy American mandates, and codify LGBTQ+ protections.
billsSigned: S.1454: Made in America Manufacturing Act
S.1321: Public Option and Mental Health Parity Act

name: Ron Johnson
bio: Ron Johnson is the senior U.S. Senator from Wisconsin, elected in 2010 after a career in manufacturing. Known for his fiscal conservatism and skepticism of government overreach, Johnson has been a vocal critic of pandemic policy, federal spending, and regulatory expansion. He serves on the Homeland Security, Budget, and Foreign Relations Committees.
education: University of Minnesota (BS)
endorsements: Club for Growth, National Taxpayers Union, Wisconsin Manufacturers & Commerce
platform: Fiscal restraint, regulatory rollback, national security, and health freedom.

platformFollowThrough.Fiscal Restraint: Opposes deficit spending and advocates for entitlement reform.
platformFollowThrough.Regulatory Rollback: Supports deregulation across energy, health, and finance sectors.
platformFollowThrough.National Security: Backs border enforcement and cybersecurity investment.
platformFollowThrough.Health Freedom: Criticized federal mandates and supports medical autonomy.

proposals: Audit federal agencies, repeal pandemic-era mandates, and expand border surveillance.
billsSigned: S.1455: Federal Agency Audit and Accountability Act

name: Cynthia Lummis
bio: Cynthia Lummis is the junior U.S. Senator from Wyoming, elected in 2020 after serving four terms in the U.S. House and as Wyoming State Treasurer. A staunch fiscal conservative and vocal advocate for cryptocurrency, Lummis focuses on financial innovation, energy independence, and federal restraint. She serves on the Banking, Environment, and Commerce Committees.
education: University of Wyoming (BS, JD)
endorsements: Club for Growth, Wyoming Mining Association, Bitcoin Policy Institute
platform: Financial innovation, energy independence, federal restraint, and Western land rights.

platformFollowThrough.Financial Innovation: Promotes Bitcoin adoption and crypto-friendly regulation.
platformFollowThrough.Energy Independence: Supports fossil fuel development and deregulation.
platformFollowThrough.Federal Restraint: Advocates for reduced federal spending and agency oversight.
platformFollowThrough.Western Land Rights: Defends state control over public lands and grazing access.

proposals: Establish crypto banking standards, expand domestic energy leases, and audit federal land management.
billsSigned: S.1323: Western Land Sovereignty and Energy Act
